summary: Build a simple romantic interactive Valentine web page (HTML/CSS/JS) asking Tamanna to be Valentine, with Yes/No buttons where No evades hover and Yes shows a pasted image and message, optimized to run on iPad Chrome.
architectural_notes: Implement as a standalone static HTML file with embedded CSS and JavaScript for easy local use on iPad Chrome.

existing_features.title: Create a single-page romantic Valentine experience that asks: "Will you be my Valentine, Tamanna?" with exactly two visible options: "Yes" and "No".
Implement the evasive "No" button behavior: when the user hovers over or points at "No", it moves to a different position so it is difficult/impossible to click.
Implement the "Yes" click behavior: on clicking "Yes", replace the prompt/buttons with a success view that displays the provided photo and the message "Good choice".

Apply a consistent romantic theme using a pink-and-white color scheme, with cohesive typography, spacing, and subtle romantic UI accents (e.g., hearts, soft gradients, gentle animations) while keeping the page simple and single-purpose.
Ensure the page works smoothly on iPad Chrome: responsive layout, large tap targets, and interaction handling that does not depend solely on mouse hover.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create a single-purpose romantic Valentine page asking Tamanna to be the user's Valentine, using a pink/white theme.
Add Yes/No options where the No button moves away on hover to prevent clicking.
On Yes click, display the user-provided pasted image and show a 'Good choice' message.
Ensure the page is fully interactive and easy to run locally on iPad using Chrome (HTML/CSS/JS).

projectName: Romantic Valentine single-purpose interactive page (Yes/No evasive button + photo reveal)
